description:
First-year middle school girls Mirai Momoyama and Emo Moegi are two aspiring idols who decide to use the "Pri☆Chan System," a system used by famous people and companies to broadcast content. Like many girls starting their own channels and uploading content, the pair decide to become their own producers, starting their own channel in an attempt to become Pri☆Chan idols.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aho_boy)

Hiroshi Ikehata is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/heichin26)

Kazuho Hyoudou is a Japanese anime screenwriter and light novel writer. Currently a freelancer. He graduated from the Department of Film and Visual Arts in Osaka University of Arts. He previously worked as a production manager at [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise). Later debuting as a screenwriter on [Shutsugeki! Machine Robo Rescue](https://anilist.co/anime/3098/Shutsugeki-Machine-Robo-Rescue/) in 2003. Since then, he has written scripts for several anime series. His more recent notable works include [Tonikaku Kawaii](https://anilist.co/anime/116267/TONIKAWA-Over-The-Moon-For-You/) and [ReLIFE](https://anilist.co/anime/21049/ReLIFE/)

He has also worked as a scenario writer on the Xenoblade Chronicles series of video games by [Nintendo](https://anilist.co/staff/280450/Nintendo)

__Notable works outside anime:__

- Xenoblade Chronicles X (Video Game, 2015) (Scenario)
- Xenoblade Chronicles 2 (Video Game, 2017) (Scenario)
- Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (Video Game, 2022) (Scenario)

node.description: Website | Twitter | Blog (JP) __Formed:__ July 30, 2017 Biography: Run Girls, Run! (abbreviated as RGR) is an idol group created for the [Wake Up, Girls!](https://anilist.co/anime/19023) (franchise). Much like Wake Up, Girls!, the unit acts as a fictional group in the [Wake Up, Girls!](https://anilist.co/anime/19023/Wake-Up-Girls/) universe and also take part in real life idol activities. They made their first anime appearance in Wake Up, Girls! New Chapter. Run Girls, Run! was formed through the "avex x 81 Produce Wake Up, Girls! AUDITION 3rd Anisong Vocal Audition". The group made their real life debut at the Wonder Festival "WONDERFUL HOBBY LIFE FOR YOU!!26" event by singing covers of 16-Sai no Agape and Tachiagare!. Members: Hayashi Koko（林鼓子） Hayashi Koko who is born May 15, 2002 in Shizuoka Prefecture, Japan is a voice actress (seiyuu) affiliated with the agency 81 Produce. She voices Hayashi Ayumi (速志歩) in the Wake Up, Girls! (franchise), starting with Wake Up, Girls! Shin Shou, which is in fact her first voice acting role. Morishima Yuka（森嶋優花） Morishima Yuka who is born March 16, 1997 in Kyoto, Japan is a voice actress (seiyuu) affiliated with 81 Produce. She voices Morishima Otome (守島音芽) in the Wake Up, Girls! (franchise), starting with Wake Up, Girls! Shin Shou, which is in fact her first voice acting role as well. Atsugi Nanami（厚木那奈美） Atsugi Nanami who is born October 11, 1997 in Nagano Prefecture, Japan is a voice actress (seiyuu) affiliated with 81 Produce. She voices Atsugi Itsuka (阿津木いつか) in the Wake Up, Girls! (franchise), starting with Wake Up, Girls! Shin Shou, which is in fact also her first voice acting role. (Source: rungirlsrun.jp) It was announced via Twitter on March 31, 2023 that Run Girls, Run! had disbanded.

**[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kat.njima)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kat_njima)**

**Katsuhiro Nakajima** is a Japanese sound effects creator/editor working for [Swara Production](https://anidb.net/creator/3214).
